nodes.text: The Taanab exercise was a problem that students in Luke Skywalker's Jedi academy on Yavin 4 were asked to solve as part of their training.

The problem simulated was about a flood that was about to strike a Taanabi village. The students were asked to bring up the best solution to the problem. Anakin Solo found a way to create a levee by using the Force to loosen some rocks. While Anakin got high marks for the solution, he had not paid enough attention to the history of the village, a fact which was later criticized by Mara Jade Skywalker during their stay on Dantooine. Apparently, the residents of the village knowingly settled in the floodplain, thus were in a constant danger of being flooded. Anakin's solution, while being effective on the spot, didn't provide the settlers with a way to independently solve the problem, leaving them to trust the Jedi next time disaster struck.
